\subsection{config.ctrl\_vector\_pmsm\_2kW module}
\label{\detokenize{config:module-config.ctrl_vector_pmsm_2kW}}\label{\detokenize{config:config-ctrl-vector-pmsm-2kw-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!config.ctrl\_vector\_pmsm\_2kW@\spxentry{config.ctrl\_vector\_pmsm\_2kW}}\index{config.ctrl\_vector\_pmsm\_2kW@\spxentry{config.ctrl\_vector\_pmsm\_2kW}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script configures sensorless vector control for a 2.2\sphinxhyphen{}kW permanent\sphinxhyphen{}magnet
synchronous motor drive.
\index{BaseValues (class in config.ctrl\_vector\_pmsm\_2kW)@\spxentry{BaseValues}\spxextra{class in config.ctrl\_vector\_pmsm\_2kW}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\subsection{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_2kW module}
\label{\detokenize{config:module-config.ctrl_vhz_im_2kW}}\label{\detokenize{config:config-ctrl-vhz-im-2kw-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_2kW@\spxentry{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_2kW}}\index{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_2kW@\spxentry{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_2kW}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script configures V/Hz control for an induction motor. The default values
correspond to a 2.2\sphinxhyphen{}kW induction motor.

\subsection{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_45kW module}
\label{\detokenize{config:module-config.ctrl_vhz_im_45kW}}\label{\detokenize{config:config-ctrl-vhz-im-45kw-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_45kW@\spxentry{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_45kW}}\index{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_45kW@\spxentry{config.ctrl\_vhz\_im\_45kW}!module@\spxentry{module}}

correspond to a 45\sphinxhyphen{}kW induction motor.

\paragraph{control.im.vector module}
\label{\detokenize{control.im:module-control.im.vector}}\label{\detokenize{control.im:control-im-vector-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!control.im.vector@\spxentry{control.im.vector}}\index{control.im.vector@\spxentry{control.im.vector}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module includes vector control methods for induction motor drives.
\index{CurrentCtrl (class in control.im.vector)@\spxentry{CurrentCtrl}\spxextra{class in control.im.vector}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.im:control.im.vector.CurrentCtrl}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{control.im.vector.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CurrentCtrl}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{pars}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A current controller corresponding to the paper Flux\sphinxhyphen{}linkage\sphinxhyphen{}based current
control of saturated synchronous motors:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2019.291925}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The continuous\sphinxhyphen{}time complex\sphinxhyphen{}vector design corresponding to (13) is used
here. This design could be equivalently presented as a 2DOF PI controller.
For better performance at high speed with low sampling frequencies, the
discrete\sphinxhyphen{}time design in (18) is recommended.
\index{output() (control.im.vector.CurrentCtrl method)@\spxentry{output()}\spxextra{control.im.vector.CurrentCtrl method}}

\index{CurrentRef (class in control.im.vector)@\spxentry{CurrentRef}\spxextra{class in control.im.vector}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.im:control.im.vector.CurrentRef}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{control.im.vector.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CurrentRef}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{pars}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class contains a method for current reference computation with
field weakening based on the voltage reference. The field\sphinxhyphen{}weakening method
and its tuning corresponds roughly to the paper Braking scheme for
vector\sphinxhyphen{}controlled induction motor drives equipped with diode rectifier
without braking resistor:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2006.880852}
\end{quote}
\index{output() (control.im.vector.CurrentRef method)@\spxentry{output()}\spxextra{control.im.vector.CurrentRef method}}

\pysigstopsignatures

\item {}

\index{SensorlessObserver (class in control.im.vector)@\spxentry{SensorlessObserver}\spxextra{class in control.im.vector}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.im:control.im.vector.SensorlessObserver}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{control.im.vector.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{SensorlessObserver}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{pars}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Sensorless reduced\sphinxhyphen{}order observer corresponding to the paper
Reduced\sphinxhyphen{}order flux observers with stator\sphinxhyphen{}resistance adaptation for
speed\sphinxhyphen{}sensorless induction motor drives:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1109/TPEL.2009.2039650}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This implementation corresponds to (26)\sphinxhyphen{}(30) with the fixed selection
c = w\_s**2 in (17). This selection allows to avoid the algebraic loop
in (26b). The closed\sphinxhyphen{}loop poles, cf. (40), can still be affected via the
choice of the coefficient b \textgreater{} 0.
\index{output() (control.im.vector.SensorlessObserver method)@\spxentry{output()}\spxextra{control.im.vector.SensorlessObserver method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures

\end{fulllineitems}

\paragraph{control.im.vhz module}
\label{\detokenize{control.im:module-control.im.vhz}}\label{\detokenize{control.im:control-im-vhz-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!control.im.vhz@\spxentry{control.im.vhz}}\index{control.im.vhz@\spxentry{control.im.vhz}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module includes V/Hz control for induction motor drives. The method
is similar to the paper On the stability of volts\sphinxhyphen{}per\sphinxhyphen{}hertz control for
induction motors:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1109/JESTPE.2021.3060583}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Open\sphinxhyphen{}loop V/Hz control can be obtained as a special case by choosing:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
R\_s, R\_R = 0, 0
k\_u, k\_w = 0, 0
\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The low\sphinxhyphen{}pass\sphinxhyphen{}filtered values are marked with ref at the end of the variable
name. These slowly varying quasi\sphinxhyphen{}steady\sphinxhyphen{}state quantities can be seen to
represent the operating point.
\index{VHzCtrl (class in control.im.vhz)@\spxentry{VHzCtrl}\spxextra{class in control.im.vhz}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.im:control.im.vhz.VHzCtrl}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{control.im.vhz.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{VHzCtrl}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{pars}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
V/Hz control algorithm with the stator current feedback.
\index{stator\_freq() (control.im.vhz.VHzCtrl method)@\spxentry{stator\_freq()}\spxextra{control.im.vhz.VHzCtrl method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.im:control.im.vhz.VHzCtrl.stator_freq}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{stator\_freq}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{w\_s\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{i\_s}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Computes the dynamic stator frequency reference used in
the coordinate transformations.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{voltage\_reference() (control.im.vhz.VHzCtrl method)@\spxentry{voltage\_reference()}\spxextra{control.im.vhz.VHzCtrl method}}

\paragraph{control.sm.torque module}
\label{\detokenize{control.sm:module-control.sm.torque}}\label{\detokenize{control.sm:control-sm-torque-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!control.sm.torque@\spxentry{control.sm.torque}}\index{control.sm.torque@\spxentry{control.sm.torque}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This file contains computation and plotting of torque characteristics for
synchronous machines, including the MTPA and MTPV loci. The methods can be used
to define look\sphinxhyphen{}up tables for control as well as to analyze the characteristics.
In this version, the magnetic saturation is omitted.
\index{TorqueCharacteristics (class in control.sm.torque)@\spxentry{TorqueCharacteristics}\spxextra{class in control.sm.torque}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.sm:control.sm.torque.TorqueCharacteristics}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{control.sm.torque.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{TorqueCharacteristics}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{pars}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Computes MTPA and MTPV loci based on the motor parameters. The magnetic
saturation is omitted.

\index{mtpv\_current() (control.sm.torque.TorqueCharacteristics method)@\spxentry{mtpv\_current()}\spxextra{control.sm.torque.TorqueCharacteristics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.sm:control.sm.torque.TorqueCharacteristics.mtpv_current}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{mtpv\_current}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{abs\_i\_s}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compute the MTPV based on the current magnitude, i.e., the intersection
of the MTPV current locus and the current limit circle. This method is
not necessary for computing the control look\sphinxhyphen{}up tables. It is used here
to cut the MTPV characteristics at the desired current. Alternatively
just a large enough maximum flux magnitude could be used.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{abs\_i\_s}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Stator current magnitude.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{i\_s} \textendash{} MTPV stator current.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
complex

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\paragraph{control.sm.vector module}
\label{\detokenize{control.sm:module-control.sm.vector}}\label{\detokenize{control.sm:control-sm-vector-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!control.sm.vector@\spxentry{control.sm.vector}}\index{control.sm.vector@\spxentry{control.sm.vector}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains vector control for PMSM drives.
\index{CurrentCtrl (class in control.sm.vector)@\spxentry{CurrentCtrl}\spxextra{class in control.sm.vector}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.sm:control.sm.vector.CurrentCtrl}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{control.sm.vector.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CurrentCtrl}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{pars}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A current controller corresponding to the paper Flux\sphinxhyphen{}linkage\sphinxhyphen{}based current
control of saturated synchronous motors:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2019.291925}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The continuous\sphinxhyphen{}time complex\sphinxhyphen{}vector design corresponding to (13) is used
here. This design could be equivalently presented as a 2DOF PI controller.
For better performance at high speeds with low sampling frequencies, the
discrete\sphinxhyphen{}time design in (18) is recommended.
\index{output() (control.sm.vector.CurrentCtrl method)@\spxentry{output()}\spxextra{control.sm.vector.CurrentCtrl method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.sm:control.sm.vector.CurrentCtrl.output}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{output}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{i\_s\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{i\_s}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compute the unlimited voltage reference.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{i\_s}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{complex}}) \textendash{} Measured current.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {}

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{CurrentRef (class in control.sm.vector)@\spxentry{CurrentRef}\spxextra{class in control.sm.vector}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{control.sm:control.sm.vector.CurrentRef}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{control.sm.vector.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CurrentRef}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{pars}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This reference calculation method resembles the method presented in
Analytical design and autotuning of adaptive flux\sphinxhyphen{}weakening voltage
regulation loop in IPMSM drives with accurate torque regulation:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2019.2942807}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Instead of the PI controller, we use a simpler integral controller with a
constant gain. The resulting operating\sphinxhyphen{}point\sphinxhyphen{}dependent closed\sphinxhyphen{}loop pole
could be derived using (12) of the paper. The MTPV limit is also included
by means of limiting the reference torque and the d\sphinxhyphen{}axis current reference.
\index{output() (control.sm.vector.CurrentRef method)@\spxentry{output()}\spxextra{control.sm.vector.CurrentRef method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compute the stator current reference.

\index{SensorlessObserver (class in control.sm.vector)@\spxentry{SensorlessObserver}\spxextra{class in control.sm.vector}}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A sensorless observer corresponding to the paper Observers for sensorless
synchronous motor drives: Framework for design and analysis:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2018.2858753}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The observer gain decouples the electrical and mechanical dynamicas and
allows placing the poles of the corresponding linearized estimation
error dynamics.

\subsection{model.converter module}
\label{\detokenize{model:module-model.converter}}\label{\detokenize{model:model-converter-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!model.converter@\spxentry{model.converter}}\index{model.converter@\spxentry{model.converter}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains models for the power converter. The inverter with the
constant DC\sphinxhyphen{}bus voltage and the frequency converter with the diode
front\sphinxhyphen{}end rectifier are modeled.

instants and the switching states are explicitly and exactly computed from
the duty ratios. The switching instants can be used in the ODE solver.
